roleset.name: chop sloppily
roleset.note: HACK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'hack' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 21.1-1, 26.1, and 23.2. (from hack.01-v predicate notes)
HACKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on hack.01. Corresponds to VNcls build-26.1, cut-21.1-1. (from hacking.01-n)

example.name: hack-v: table manners
example.text: John hacked at the expensive cut of beef with a butter knife.
example.arg: at the expensive cut of beef

example.name: hacking-n: all args
example.text: Mary's hacking the Thanksgiving turkey with a dull ttable knife really irritated John, who considered himself a master carver.

roleset.name: remove pieces
roleset.note: HACKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on hack.03. Corresponds to VNcls split-23.2. (from hacking.03-n)

example.name: hack-v: bad haircut
example.text: John hacked great chunks of hair from his back with safety scissors.

example.name: hacking-n: all args
example.text: John's hacking pieces out of the dining room table with a tiny axe really angered Mary.
example.arg: out of the dining room table

roleset.name: computer work, breaking into, as on a computer
roleset.note: HACK-V NOTES: The Fairmount Bagel Institute is a real business, btw, or at leastused to be. (from hack.04-v)
HACKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, hack.04. No VNcls. (from hacking.04-n)

example.name: hack-v: probably legal
example.text: John-1 spent all night *trace*-1 hacking his artificial intelligence program.

example.name: hack-v: probably not
example.text: John hacked into the FBI's mainframe. The Fairmount Bagel Institute, that is.

example.name: hacking-n: arg1
example.text: News International has agreed to admit , in selected cases , liability for phone hacking .

example.name: hacking-n: args 0 and 1
example.text: A Florida man pleaded guilty today to a series of cyber-related crimes relating to his hacking into the personal e-mail accounts of more than 50 individuals associated with the entertainment industry.
example.arg: into the personal e-mail accounts of more than 50 individuals associated with the entertainment industry

roleset.name: cough
roleset.note: HACK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'hack' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entries 21.1-1, 26.1, and 23.2. (from hack.05-v predicate notes)
HACKING-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on hack.05. No VNcls. (from hacking.05-n)

example.name: hacking-n: typical
example.text: Michael got up at 11:00 last night and was running a slight fever in addition to his hacking all night.

roleset.name: succeed, manage
roleset.note: HACK-V NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.

example.name: hack-v
example.text: A kid who-1 [*-1] can't (for whatever reason) hack high school in no way will be successful in higher education.

role.descr: domain in which the trick is useful

example.name: hack-n
example.text: Audio wonks will love the details of the This American Life recording setup (they record interviews using a $240 AudioTechnica shotgun mic), but the real gem of the interview is his best life hack, "...my wife and I decided to live just a few blocks from where I work. We did this because of our dog. Since I spend at least an hour every night walking the dog, I didn't want to spend another 60 or 90 minutes a day commuting."
example.arg: "...my wife and I decided to live just a few blocks from where I work. We did this because of our dog. Since I spend at least an hour every night walking the dog, I didn't want to spend another 60 or 90 minutes a day commuting."

roleset.name: phrasal chop sloppily
roleset.note: HACKING_AWAY-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on hack.02, which is based on hack.01. See associated VNcls. (from hacking.06-n)

example.name: hack_away-v: the one corpus example
example.text: Mr. Wathen says his turnaround strategy has been simple: *trace* just hack away at the fat.

example.name: hacking_away-n: Whoa.
example.text: For a few heartbeats Master Cook regards me with wild eyes, then he resumes his hacking away at the turnips.
